user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UtAssert_DoReport:
```c
void UtAssert_DoReport(const char *File, uint32 LineNum, uint32 SegmentNum, uint32 TestSeq, uint8 MessageType,
                       const char *SubsysName, const char *ShortDesc)
{
    uint32      FileLen;
    const char *BasePtr;
    char        ReportBuffer[320];

    FileLen = strlen(File);
    BasePtr = File + FileLen;
    while (FileLen > 0)
    {
        --BasePtr;
        --FileLen;
        if (*BasePtr == '/' || *BasePtr == '\\')
        {
            ++BasePtr;
            break;
        }
    }

    snprintf(ReportBuffer, sizeof(ReportBuffer), "%02u.%03u %s:%u - %s", (unsigned int)SegmentNum,
             (unsigned int)TestSeq, BasePtr, (unsigned int)LineNum, ShortDesc);

    UT_BSP_DoText(MessageType, ReportBuffer);
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function UtAssert_DoReport:
typedef uint32_t  uint32
...
typedef uint8_t   uint8
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Most pointer uses in the function already use const qualification where appropriate: the input parameters File, SubsysName, and ShortDesc are declared as const char * and are only read; BasePtr is declared as const char * and only points into File (read-only). Calls that read from const data (e.g. strlen(File), passing BasePtr and ShortDesc to snprintf) therefore do not violate the rule. The ReportBuffer declaration and the subsequent call that passes it to UT_BSP_DoText are the only places where a non-const character object is exposed as a pointer to another function; the buffer must be mutable for snprintf (so the local declaration itself cannot be const), but the callee prototype should be checked to determine whether it could or should accept a const-qualified pointer (i.e. whether UT_BSP_DoText modifies the string). No other pointer occurrences in this function require investigation under Rule 8.13.
